page.title: 19SUPERNATURAL-GHOST STORY.
page.content: Gail Stothard, a 3rd year pupil at the King James 1 School, B/Auckland, lives at Flatts Farm ref04200530, the scene of this mysterious story. Apparitions of two distinct forms have been seen by various members of the family; a woman appearing at the foot of the stairs, and "stick-people" on the bedroom walls (Gails terminology). The woman, dressed in long skirt and blouse, appears unpredictably, often forcing the mother to close her eyes when decending the stairs. Strangely the wall figures only appear when the bedrooms are stripped ready for redecorating. They look drawn and haggard, hence Gails name, & partly clad. They even appear on a later di- viding wall; fronts on one side, backs on the other. At such times doors jamb & have to be opened from the landing. Recent CofE exorcism; result unknown.
